conclusion: Analyze forces acting on suitcase and use equilibrium conditions to find angle θ and coefficient of friction μ.
Identify forces: weight W = mg = 150 N, normal force N, tension T, frictional force F_f = μN.
Resolve pull into components: horizontal T cos θ, vertical T sin θ.
Set up vertical equilibrium equation: N + T sin θ = W.
Set up horizontal equilibrium equation: T cos θ = μN.
Substitute N from vertical into horizontal equation: T cos θ = μ(W - T sin θ).
Rearrange to solve for T: T = μW / (cos θ + μ sin θ).
Use condition that minimum pull value is 90 N.
Substitute W = 150 N into equation: 90 = 150μ / (cos θ + μ sin θ).
Solve for cos θ + μ sin θ: cos θ + μ sin θ = 5μ/3.
Determine μ using maximum value of cos θ + μ sin θ: √(1 + μ²) = 5μ/3.
Substitute μ = 3/4 into equation: cos θ + 3/4 sin θ = 5/4.
